#pip install spacy && python -m spacy download en
import spacy
from spacy import displacy
from spacy.tokens import Token

#load the language model for English
nlp = spacy.load('en')

doc1 = nlp(u'‚≠ê intro to a üåü tool! üïµÔ∏è RegExplain by @grrrck https://buff.ly/2HXtBZ1  #rstats #RegEx')

alpha = []
not_alpha = []
noun_chunks = []
sentiment = 0

def is_positive(text):
    positive = [u'‚≠ê', u'üåü', u'üòÄ', u'üî•', u'‚ú®', u'üëç', u'üëè']
    # want to use an existing sentiment system, for en? check out NLTK Vader
    # just note: it doesn't deal with unicode emoji only ascii emoji :) welcome to pitfalls
    return text in positive

SENTIMENT_POS = nlp.vocab.add_flag(is_positive)

#tokenization and checking for sentiment
for token in doc1:
    if token.is_alpha: # language specific alphabet characters 
        alpha.append(token.text)
    else:
        not_alpha.append(token.text)
        
    if token.check_flag(SENTIMENT_POS): # custom vocabulary registered callback (ex true or false) 
        sentiment +=1


print("alpha: ", " ".join(alpha))
print("not_alpha: ", " ".join(not_alpha))
print("sentiment score: ", sentiment)

import re

review = "We drove 30min out of our way to get some dessert and ordered a ton to go... \
Only to find that they didn't give us what we ordered. \
What we did get was not good. We called and they refunded us $4.... \
Ridiculous. Don't waste your time or money here. Sixth Course right around the corner is WAY better."

# Expand contractions using regular expressions
review = re.sub(r'(\w+)n\'t', r'\g<1>' + " not", review)

doc2 = nlp(review)

filtered_tokens = []
named_entities = []

#Filter stopwords and punctuation
for token in doc2: 
    if not token.is_punct and not token.is_stop and token.pos_ !='PRON':
        filtered_tokens.append(token.lemma_)
            
#List of named entity labels to look for in the text
tracked_ne = ['PERSON', 'ORG', 'GPE', 'DATE', 'MONEY', 'CARDINAL', 'QUANTITY']
for named_entity in doc2.ents:
    if named_entity.label_ in tracked_ne:
        named_entities.append(named_entity.text)

print("words: ", " ".join(filtered_tokens))
print("named entities: ", ", ".join(named_entities))
